elements.content: The luminescent chiral coordination polymer {[Cd(pht)(dpa)(H2O)]·4H2O} n (pht = phthalate; dpa = 4,4′-dipyridylamine) possesses an unprecedented 4-connected uninodal self-catenated three-dimensional 7482 network topology, constructed from the interlocking of [Cd(dpa)] n double helices with [Cd(pht)] n single helices.
elements.clean_text: The luminescent chiral coordination polymer {[Cd(pht)(dpa)(H2O)]⋅4H2O} n  (pht = phthalate; dpa = 4,4'-dipyridylamine) possesses an unprecedented 4-connected uninodal self-catenated three-dimensional 7482 network topology, constructed from the interlocking of [Cd(dpa)] n  double helices with [Cd(pht)] n  single helices.

elements.content: The luminescent chiral coordination polymer {[Cd(pht)(dpa)(H2O)]·4H2O} n (pht = phthalate; dpa = 4,4′-dipyridylamine) possesses an unprecedented 4-connected uninodal self-catenated three-dimensional 7482 network topology, constructed from the interlocking of [Cd(dpa)] n double helices with [Cd(pht)] n single helices.
elements.clean_text: The luminescent chiral coordination polymer {[Cd(pht)(dpa)(H2O)]⋅4H2O} n  (pht = phthalate; dpa = 4,4'-dipyridylamine) possesses an unprecedented 4-connected uninodal self-catenated three-dimensional 7482 network topology, constructed from the interlocking of [Cd(dpa)] n  double helices with [Cd(pht)] n  single helices.

elements.content: The mutual interpenetration of three-dimensional (3D) networks is a common feature of coordination polymer structures. These aesthetic networks can often possess topologies mimicking those of known structure types (e.g., α-Po, PtS, SrAl2), with longer tethering ligands promoting higher degrees of interpenetration. In comparison, coordination polymers manifesting self-catenation, in which connecting rods of the network penetrate through the shortest circuits of the same network, are more limited in scope. Self-catenated topologies can be deceptively simple, for example, in the regular (12,3)-twt net evident in the cationic [Ni(tpt)] n 2n+ framework (tpt = tri-4-pyridyl-1,3,5-triazine). On the other hand, these networks can be quite complex and highly connected, for example, in {[Ni(oba)(4,4′-bipyridine)]·H2O} n (oba = oxybisbenzoate), which has a (4.82)(4.64.84.10) 3,5-connected self-catenated binodal topology, or in [Co3(oba)3(bpmp)2] n [bpmp = bis(4-pyridylmethyl)piperazine], which presents a uninodal 8-connected self-catenated net with a unique 4451767 topology.
elements.clean_text: The mutual interpenetration of three-dimensional (3D) networks is a common feature of coordination polymer structures. These aesthetic networks can often possess topologies mimicking those of known structure types (e.g., α-Po, PtS, SrAl2), with longer tethering ligands promoting higher degrees of interpenetration. In comparison, coordination polymers manifesting self-catenation, in which connecting rods of the network penetrate through the shortest circuits of the same network, are more limited in scope. Self-catenated topologies can be deceptively simple, for example, in the regular (12,3)-twt net evident in the cationic [Ni(tpt)] n  2n+ framework (tpt = tri-4-pyridyl-1,3,5-triazine). On the other hand, these networks can be quite complex and highly connected, for example, in {[Ni(oba)(4,4'-bipyridine)]⋅H2O} n  (oba = oxybisbenzoate), which has a (4.82)(4.64.84.10) 3,5-connected self-catenated binodal topology, or in [Co3(oba)3(bpmp)2] n  [bpmp = bis(4-pyridylmethyl)piperazine], which presents a uninodal 8-connected self-catenated net with a unique 4451767 topology.

elements.content: Recently, we have been successful in inducing the self-assembly of self-catenated networks by employing the kinked and hydrogen-bonding-capable diimine 4,4′-dipyridylamine (dpa) as a neutral coligand in divalent metal dicarboxylate coordination polymers. {[Ni(dpa)2(succinate)0.5]Cl} n is the only example to date of a uniform 610 topology self-catenated network, while {[Co(oba)(dpa)]·H2O} n and its nickel congener represent unprecedented two-dimensional self-catenated layers with 66 topology.
elements.clean_text: Recently, we have been successful in inducing the self-assembly of self-catenated networks by employing the kinked and hydrogen-bonding-capable diimine 4,4'-dipyridylamine (dpa) as a neutral coligand in divalent metal dicarboxylate coordination polymers. {[Ni(dpa)2(succinate)0.5]Cl} n  is the only example to date of a uniform 610 topology self-catenated network, while {[Co(oba)(dpa)]⋅H2O} n  and its nickel congener represent unprecedented two-dimensional self-catenated layers with 66 topology.

elements.content: Herein we report the synthesis, structural characterization, topological analysis, and luminescent properties of the self-catenated coordination polymer {[Cd(pht)(dpa)(H2O)]·4H2O} n (1, pht = phthalate). The neutral network of compound 1 manifests the covalent linkage of helical submotifs into an elegant uninodal 4-connected self-catenated 3D framework.
elements.clean_text: Herein we report the synthesis, structural characterization, topological analysis, and luminescent properties of the self-catenated coordination polymer {[Cd(pht)(dpa)(H2O)]⋅4H2O} n  (1, pht = phthalate). The neutral network of compound 1 manifests the covalent linkage of helical submotifs into an elegant uninodal 4-connected self-catenated 3D framework.

elements.content: Hydrothermal treatment of a mixture of cadmium perchlorate, phthalic acid, and dpa in a 1:1.3:2.75 molar ratio at 120 °C for 48 h generated monophasic yellow crystals of 1 in moderate yield. Single-crystal X-ray diffraction indicated that 1 crystallized in the chiral hexagonal space group P6122 with a Flack parameter of 0.01(3), indicating enantiomeric purity within the single crystal despite the use of achiral starting materials. The asymmetric unit of 1 (Figure ) contains a divalent Cd atom, two halves of two distinct pht ligands situated across crystallographic 2-fold rotation axes (pht-A, O1−O2; pht-B, O3−O4), one dpa ligand, and one bound water molecule, along with four total water molecules of crystallization. The coordination environment at cadmium is best described as a {CdN2O5} distorted pentagonal bipyramid, with the axial positions occupied by N donor atoms from two dpa ligands. The equatorial plane consists of chelating carboxylate groups from pht-A and pht-B and an aqua ligand. The chelation of the carboxylate O atoms in pht-B [Cd−O bond distances = 2.366(3) and 2.606(3) Å] is much less symmetric than the chelation in pht-A [Cd−O bond distances = 2.486(3) and 2.514(3) Å].
elements.clean_text: Hydrothermal treatment of a mixture of cadmium perchlorate, phthalic acid, and dpa in a 1:1.3:2.75 molar ratio at 120 °C for 48 h generated monophasic yellow crystals of 1 in moderate yield. Single-crystal X-ray diffraction indicated that 1 crystallized in the chiral hexagonal space group P6122 with a Flack parameter of 0.01(3), indicating enantiomeric purity within the single crystal despite the use of achiral starting materials. The asymmetric unit of 1 (Figure ) contains a divalent Cd atom, two halves of two distinct pht ligands situated across crystallographic 2-fold rotation axes (pht-A, O1-O2; pht-B, O3-O4), one dpa ligand, and one bound water molecule, along with four total water molecules of crystallization. The coordination environment at cadmium is best described as a {CdN2O5} distorted pentagonal bipyramid, with the axial positions occupied by N donor atoms from two dpa ligands. The equatorial plane consists of chelating carboxylate groups from pht-A and pht-B and an aqua ligand. The chelation of the carboxylate O atoms in pht-B [Cd-O bond distances = 2.366(3) and 2.606(3) Å] is much less symmetric than the chelation in pht-A [Cd-O bond distances = 2.486(3) and 2.514(3) Å].

elements.content: Coordination environment of 1 with thermal ellipsoids shown at 50% probability. Complete pht-A and pht-B ligands are shown.
elements.clean_text: 1  Coordination environment of 1 with thermal ellipsoids shown at 50% probability. Complete pht-A and pht-B ligands are shown.

elements.content: Extension of the structure through the tethering dpa ligands and the crystallographic symmetry generates 6-fold homochiral right-handed [Cd(H2O)(dpa)] n 2n+ double helices that are oriented along the c crystal direction (Figure ). The Cd···Cd distances through the dpa ligands measure 12.223 Å. The slight twist between the pyridyl rings of the dpa ligands (15.0°) promotes the long 56.235 Å pitch of the double-helix motif, which defines the c lattice parameter. The inner diameter of a single double-helix pattern is approximately 16 Å, neglecting van der Waals radii.
elements.clean_text: Extension of the structure through the tethering dpa ligands and the crystallographic symmetry generates 6-fold homochiral right-handed [Cd(H2O)(dpa)] n  2n+  double helices that are oriented along the c crystal direction (Figure ). The Cd⋅⋅⋅Cd distances through the dpa ligands measure 12.223 Å. The slight twist between the pyridyl rings of the dpa ligands (15.0°) promotes the long 56.235 Å pitch of the double-helix motif, which defines the c lattice parameter. The inner diameter of a single double-helix pattern is approximately 16 Å, neglecting van der Waals radii.

elements.content: Transverse view of the [Cd(H2O)(dpa)] n 2n+ right-handed double-helix motif in 1.
elements.clean_text: 2  Transverse view of the [Cd(H2O)(dpa)] n  2n+  right-handed double-helix motif in 1.

elements.content: Neighboring homochiral [Cd(H2O)(dpa)] n 2n+ double helices aggregate to create a striking pattern (Figure ) wherein each double helix is interdigitated by six others, arranged in a hexagonal pattern. Each double-helix unit is covalently connected to both helices in six other double-helix units via bis(chelating) pht-A and pht-B ligands with a Cd···Cd through ligand distances of 7.036 and 6.791 Å, respectively. The carboxylate groups of pht-A and pht-B are twisted by 52° and 56° relative to the plane of the ligand’s aromatic ring. The Cd atoms and pht-A and pht-B ligands construct homochiral 6-fold [Cd(pht)] n single helices (Figure ). Each Cd atom is thus bridged to four others via the dpa, pht-A, and pht-B ligands, establishing a 4-connected 3D [Cd(pht)(dpa)(H2O)] n coordination polymer network within the structure of 1.
elements.clean_text: Neighboring homochiral [Cd(H2O)(dpa)] n  2n+  double helices aggregate to create a striking pattern (Figure ) wherein each double helix is interdigitated by six others, arranged in a hexagonal pattern. Each double-helix unit is covalently connected to both helices in six other double-helix units via bis(chelating) pht-A and pht-B ligands with a Cd⋅⋅⋅Cd through ligand distances of 7.036 and 6.791 Å, respectively. The carboxylate groups of pht-A and pht-B are twisted by 52° and 56° relative to the plane of the ligand's aromatic ring. The Cd atoms and pht-A and pht-B ligands construct homochiral 6-fold [Cd(pht)] n  single helices (Figure ). Each Cd atom is thus bridged to four others via the dpa, pht-A, and pht-B ligands, establishing a 4-connected 3D [Cd(pht)(dpa)(H2O)] n  coordination polymer network within the structure of 1.

elements.content: Interdigitation of [Cd(H2O)(dpa)] n 2n+ homochiral double-helix motifs in 1.
elements.clean_text: 3  Interdigitation of [Cd(H2O)(dpa)] n  2n+  homochiral double-helix motifs in 1.

elements.content: Side view of a [Cd(H2O)(pht)] n homochiral single-helix motif in 1.
elements.clean_text: 4  Side view of a [Cd(H2O)(pht)] n  homochiral single-helix motif in 1.

elements.content: As determined by TOPOS software, the Schäfli symbol for this 4-connected uninodal network is 7482, representing a relatively simple yet unprecedented self-catenated topology (Figure ). The Long vertex symbol is 7.7.72.73.82.83 with a coordination sequence of 4, 12, 36, 73, 136, 213, 296, 395, 514, and 648. The eight-membered circuits within this net are responsible for the self-catenation (Figure ). Chirality of the overall self-catenated network is imposed by the homochiral [Cd(H2O)(dpa)] n 2n+ and [Cd(pht)] n helical submotifs. If the pht-A ligands are neglected and each Cd atom is treated as a 3-connected node, a triply interpenetrated system of self-catenated regular (12,3)-twt networks can be invoked as a subnet (Figure S1 in the ). There has only been one prior report of an interpenetrated self-catenated uninodal lattice: the doubly interpenetrated (12,3)-twt networks within the structure of [Co(2,2′-bipyridine-4,4′-dicarboxylate)(H2O)2] n , identified by Ciani et al. Nevertheless, there is no true system of mutually interpenetrated networks in the structure of 1 because of the overall self-catenation of the 4-connected coordination polymer framework.
elements.clean_text: As determined by TOPOS software, the Schäfli symbol for this 4-connected uninodal network is 7482, representing a relatively simple yet unprecedented self-catenated topology (Figure ). The Long vertex symbol is 7.7.72.73.82.83 with a coordination sequence of 4, 12, 36, 73, 136, 213, 296, 395, 514, and 648. The eight-membered circuits within this net are responsible for the self-catenation (Figure ). Chirality of the overall self-catenated network is imposed by the homochiral [Cd(H2O)(dpa)] n  2n+  and [Cd(pht)] n  helical submotifs. If the pht-A ligands are neglected and each Cd atom is treated as a 3-connected node, a triply interpenetrated system of self-catenated regular (12,3)-twt networks can be invoked as a subnet (Figure S1 in the ). There has only been one prior report of an interpenetrated self-catenated uninodal lattice: the doubly interpenetrated (12,3)-twt networks within the structure of [Co(2,2'-bipyridine-4,4'-dicarboxylate)(H2O)2] n , identified by Ciani et al. Nevertheless, there is no true system of mutually interpenetrated networks in the structure of 1 because of the overall self-catenation of the 4-connected coordination polymer framework.

elements.content: Network perspective of the 7482 self-catenated 4-connected topology of 1. pht-A, pht-B, and dpa ligands are shown as green, red, and blue rods, respectively.
elements.clean_text: 5  Network perspective of the 7482 self-catenated 4-connected topology of 1. pht-A, pht-B, and dpa ligands are shown as green, red, and blue rods, respectively.

elements.content: Closeup of the self-catenation of eight-membered rings in 1. The Cd atoms within the self-catenated rings are shown in blue and orange. The red rod indicates the dpa ligand that causes the self-catenation; the green rod denotes the pht-A ligand that connects the two rings.
elements.clean_text: 6  Closeup of the self-catenation of eight-membered rings in 1. The Cd atoms within the self-catenated rings are shown in blue and orange. The red rod indicates the dpa ligand that causes the self-catenation; the green rod denotes the pht-A ligand that connects the two rings.

elements.content: The incipient voids within the 7482 network of 1 are occupied by the water molecules of crystallization, anchored to the coordination polymer matrix via hydrogen-bonding mechanisms involving the central amine groups of the dpa tethers, the carboxylate O atoms of the pht ligands, and the bound water molecules. Compound 1 contains a solvent-accessible void space of 22.1% of the unit cell volume according to a calculation performed using PLATON. These voids are occupied by discrete chains of four cocrystallized water molecules (Figure S2 in the ).
elements.clean_text: The incipient voids within the 7482 network of 1 are occupied by the water molecules of crystallization, anchored to the coordination polymer matrix via hydrogen-bonding mechanisms involving the central amine groups of the dpa tethers, the carboxylate O atoms of the pht ligands, and the bound water molecules. Compound 1 contains a solvent-accessible void space of 22.1% of the unit cell volume according to a calculation performed using PLATON. These voids are occupied by discrete chains of four cocrystallized water molecules (Figure S2 in the ).

elements.content: The desolvation and degradation behavior of 1 was investigated by thermogravimetric analysis (Figure S3 in the ). Dehydration commenced at ∼50 °C and was complete by ∼120 °C. The 16.0% observed mass loss was consistent with the loss of the aqua ligands and all of the cocrystallized water (16.9% calcd). The mass remained largely steady between ∼120 and ∼230 °C, whereupon the likely destruction of the self-catenated coordination polymer net occurred. Elimination of the bound water and organic components was observed between ∼230 and 650 °C. The final mass remnant of 31.8% at 650 °C corresponds to the likely deposition of CdCO3 (31.9% calcd).
elements.clean_text: The desolvation and degradation behavior of 1 was investigated by thermogravimetric analysis (Figure S3 in the ). Dehydration commenced at ~50 °C and was complete by ~120 °C. The 16.0% observed mass loss was consistent with the loss of the aqua ligands and all of the cocrystallized water (16.9% calcd). The mass remained largely steady between ~120 and ~230 °C, whereupon the likely destruction of the self-catenated coordination polymer net occurred. Elimination of the bound water and organic components was observed between ~230 and 650 °C. The final mass remnant of 31.8% at 650 °C corresponds to the likely deposition of CdCO3 (31.9% calcd).

elements.content: Irradiation of a polycrystalline sample of 1 with ultraviolet light (λ ex = 300 nm) resulted in a broad visible light emission spanning from violet to green wavelengths (400−550 nm), along with a narrower ultraviolet emission centered on 340 nm (Figure ). To the naked eye, the emission appears bluish-white. Similar to other divalent cadmium-based coordination polymers incorporating aromatic ligands, this emissive behavior is ascribed to π → π* transitions within the molecular orbital manifolds of pyridyl and phenyl rings of the dpa and phthlate moieties, respectively.
elements.clean_text: Irradiation of a polycrystalline sample of 1 with ultraviolet light (λ ex = 300 nm) resulted in a broad visible light emission spanning from violet to green wavelengths (400-550 nm), along with a narrower ultraviolet emission centered on 340 nm (Figure ). To the naked eye, the emission appears bluish-white. Similar to other divalent cadmium-based coordination polymers incorporating aromatic ligands, this emissive behavior is ascribed to π → π* transitions within the molecular orbital manifolds of pyridyl and phenyl rings of the dpa and phthlate moieties, respectively.

elements.content: Luminescence spectrum of a polycrystalline sample of 1.
elements.clean_text: 7  Luminescence spectrum of a polycrystalline sample of 1.

elements.content: In conclusion, the luminescent coordination polymer {[Cd(pht)(dpa)(H2O)]·4H2O} n displays an elegant, self-catenated unprecedented 4-connected chiral topology, constructed from interlocking homochiral [Cd(H2O)(dpa)] n 2n+ double helices and [Cd(pht)] n single helices. Efforts to prepare additional entries in the small class of self-catenated dicarboxylate coordination polymers, focusing on kinked or flexible hydrogen-bonding-capable neutral diimines, are ongoing in our laboratory.
elements.clean_text: In conclusion, the luminescent coordination polymer {[Cd(pht)(dpa)(H2O)]⋅4H2O} n  displays an elegant, self-catenated unprecedented 4-connected chiral topology, constructed from interlocking homochiral [Cd(H2O)(dpa)] n  2n+  double helices and [Cd(pht)] n  single helices. Efforts to prepare additional entries in the small class of self-catenated dicarboxylate coordination polymers, focusing on kinked or flexible hydrogen-bonding-capable neutral diimines, are ongoing in our laboratory.

elements.content:
Supplementary figures and a CIF file for 1. This material is available free of charge via the Internet at http://pubs.acs.org.

References

Cd(ClO4)2·6H2O (100 mg, 0.233 mmol), dpa (110 mg, 0.642 mmol), and phthalic acid (53 mg, 0.30 mmol) were mixed with 10 mL of deionized water in a 23 mL Teflon-lined Parr acid digestion bomb. The bomb was sealed and heated at 120 °C for 48 h, whereupon it was cooled slowly to 25 °C. Yellow blocks of 1 (73 mg, 58% yield based on Cd) were isolated after washing with deionized water and hot ethanol and drying in air. Anal. Calcd for C18H23CdN3O9: C, 40.20; H, 4.31; N, 7.81. Found: C, 39.86; H, 4.24; N, 7.69. IR (powder): ν (cm−1) 3200(w, br), 1637(w), 1596(m), 1552(s), 1522(s), 1490(m), 1442(m), 1402(s), 1361(s), 1218(s), 1146(w), 1084(w), 1073(w), 1058(w), 1017(s), 914(m), 867(m), 845(m), 821(m), 808(w), 751(s), 703(m), 663(w), 652(m)

cln_elements.content:
The desolvation and degradation behavior of 1 was investigated by thermogravimetric analysis (Figure S3 in the ). Dehydration commenced at ∼50 °C and was complete by ∼120 °C. The 16.0% observed mass loss was consistent with the loss of the aqua ligands and all of the cocrystallized water (16.9% calcd). The mass remained largely steady between ∼120 and ∼230 °C, whereupon the likely destruction of the self-catenated coordination polymer net occurred. Elimination of the bound water and organic components was observed between ∼230 and 650 °C. The final mass remnant of 31.8% at 650 °C corresponds to the likely deposition of CdCO3 (31.9% calcd).

Crystal data for 1: C18H23CdN3O9, fw = 537.80 g/mol, hexagonal, space group P6122, a = b = 11.5693(10) Å, c = 56.235(10) Å, V = 6518.6(14) Å3, Z = 12, ρ calcd = 1.638 g/cm3, μ(Mo Kα) = 1.059 mm−1, F(000) = 4590, R [I > 2σ(I)] = 0.0374, wR [I > 2σ(I)] = 0.0864, GOF = 1.205, T = 173(2) K, CCDC No. 714712.

metadata.title:
A Chiral Luminescent Coordination Polymer Featuring a Unique 4-Connected Self-Catenated Topology Built from Helical Motifs
Communication
